result.title: Centroid decomposition problem
result.content: The following POI problem: main.edu.pl/en/archive/oi/21/hot, which asks one to find the number of vertices of a tree equidistant from one vertex, has a fairly simple O(n^2) solution, which is sufficient to get full points. However, when looking at the solution, there appeared to be a O(n log n) solution that used what appeared to be centroid decomposition, though it was hard to tell, since the solution was in Polish and google translate doesn't do that good of a job. What is a solution to this problem in O(n log n) that uses centroid decomposition, and are there any other solutions that get O(n log n) or better?
